title: 'She played black': Wendy Williams weighs in on Iggy Azalea and T.I. feud
text:
Wendy Williams has weighed in on the ongoing feud between T.I. and Iggy Azalea.

The 55-year-old shared her two cents on the feud on her daytime talk show this week, responding to recent comments T.I. made about Iggy pandering to white audiences and hurting his reputation.

'I don't know Iggy Azalea, but I do believe that T.I. needs to stop talking about this,' Wendy said.

'T.I. needs to stop talking about this': Wendy Williams weighed in on the feud between T.I. and Iggy Azalea this week

'She didn't ruin your legacy, she added to it, because by you discovering her, whether you like her today or not, she did have that Fancy song.

'And then she became a household name, and that's all due to your discovery of her and honing her artistry,' she added.

Despite defending Iggy, Wendy admitted that she agreed with T.I. when it came to the issue of race.

'She didn't ruin your legacy, she added to it, because by you discovering her, whether you like her today or not, she did have that Fancy song, and something else,' Wendy said on her show

'I don't blame Iggy for turning white all of a sudden,' Wendy said.

'She's white! She played black and then she went white, and now T.I. is still talking.'

T.I.'s original comments were made during an appearance on The Breakfast Club earlier this week.

'She played black and then she went white!' Despite defending Iggy, Wendy admitted that she agreed with T.I. when it came to the issue of race

'When [Iggy] found out that white people liked her and that she didn't really need black people to like her anymore, she switched up,' the Atlanta-born rapper said.

'She started acting different, made moves that I wasn't proud of, that kind of placed my reputation in the line of fire,' he continued.

Iggy responded to the controversial remarks in a series of now-deleted tweets, telling T.I. to 'shut up'.

'When she found out that white people liked her and that she didn't really need black people to like her anymore, she switched up': T.I.'s original comments about Iggy were made during an appearance on The Breakfast Club earlier this week

'When will this guy shut up. The only song you ever were a part of making was "100,"' Iggy wrote in one tweet.

'Thank you for that, but you were NOT a part of the creative OR executive process on that album. Which is why I’ve always taken issue with you trying to approximate yourself with it’s success.'

In another tweet, she accused T.I. of 'bringing [her] up for relevance' and urged the rapper to stop talking about her in the press.

'When will this guy shut up!' Iggy fired back at T.I. in a string of now-deleted tweets

Flashback: Iggy got her big break after being signed to T.I.'s Grand Hustle Records in 2012. The pair later collaborated together on a number of hip-hop records

Iggy got her big break after being signed to T.I.'s Grand Hustle Records in 2012.

She collaborated with the American rapper on the hip-hop singles Murda Bizness and No Mediocre, before changing her sound and style to a more mainstream pop direction after topping the charts with Fancy in 2014.

Iggy returned to the charts in July with her sophomore album In My Defense, which peaked at No. 50 on the Billboard 200.
description: Wendy Williams has weighed in on the ongoing feud between T.I. and Iggy Azalea.
